titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Oversized Family Charts, undated
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in the
Thomas Balch Library OMB 019
titlepage.author: Elizabeth E. Preston

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: This collection consists of 12 family trees or other visual representations of genealogies. Several, such as the "Chichesters of Widworthy" and the Hoge family tree, are examples of artistic representations of pedigree charts as actual trees. They start with an ancestor at the base of the tree and work forward in time, with descendants as leaves on the tree. Other genealogies in the collection are less decorative in their presentation, but also start with one ancestor and work forward in time. The chart for the Dulaney and Weems families, however, is a fan chart; it starts with an individual and traces her ancestry back in time on both sides. Most are reproductions, photocopies, or computer generated prints.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Physical characteristics and conditions affect use of this material. Photocopying not permitted.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Oversized Family Charts (OMB 019), Thomas Balch Library, Leesburg, VA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: 1995 accessions come from unknown sources; Robert Lyon, Purcellville, VA; Teckla H. Cox, Leesburg, VA; Goose Creek Friends Meeting, Lincoln, VA.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The accessions made in 1995 come from unknown sources. They were extant in the collection at Thomas Balch Library when it belonged to the Loudoun County Public Library System and were transferred as part of the collection when the Town of Leesburg took over ownership of the library. This is an open and artificial collection. Oversized family charts donated to the library will be added to this collection is they do not belong with another set of material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 12 family trees or other visual representations of genealogies. Several, such as the "Chichesters of Widworthy" and the Hoge family tree, are examples of artistic representations of pedigree charts as actual trees. They start with an ancestor at the base of the tree and work forward in time, with descendants as leaves on the tree. Other genealogies in the collection are less decorative in their presentation, but also start with one ancestor and work forward in time. The chart for the Dulaney and Weems families, however, is a fan chart; it starts with an individual and traces her ancestry back in time on both sides. Most are reproductions, photocopies, or computer generated prints.
1 photocopy. Size: 61x46 cm. Tree begins with John Chichester (b. 1385).
Related holdings: Chichester Collection, ca. 1809; 1840 (M 038). Search the online indexes to the Family Files and Family Bible Records for more information on the Chichester family
1 photocopy, 3 sheets taped together. Size: 79x41 cm. Tree begins with Nathaniel Cochran (b. 1731) and Eleanore Gilmore (b. 1745).
Related holdings: Search the online catalog and indexes to the Family Files and Family Bible Records for more information on the Cochran, Gilmore, and Megeath families.

did.unittitle: Dishman (Duchemin) with supplement, created by James Dallas Dishman

scopecontent.p: Tree (1993): 1 print. Size: 73x58 cm. Tree begins with Isaac Dishman (d. 1699) and Samuel Dishman (d. 1727). Supplement (Dishmans of Loudoun County, 1995): 2 prints. Size: 57x56 cm. Tree begins with Samuel Marcus Dishman (1764-1848).
Related holdings: Search the online catalog and indexes to the Family Files and Family Bible Records for more information on the Dishman family.

did.unittitle: Duff "Principal Surviving Lines of Descent from Adam Duff of Clunybeg"

scopecontent.p: 1 photocopy, sheets taped together. Size: 23x79 cm. Tree begins with David Duff (b. 1375).
1 photocopy. Size: 74x46 cm. Fan chart begins with Anne Williams Dulaney (b. 1935) and traces back to Donald Dulaney (1685-1753).
Related holdings: Search the online catalog and indexes to the Family Files and Family Bible Records for more information on the Dulaney and Weems families.

did.unittitle: Fleming, Lee, and Rust families, created by RFR Jeffries, 22 Dec 1984

scopecontent.p: 3 photocopies. Size: 28x43 cm. Tree begins with Henry Lee (1727-1784).

Related holdings: Rust Family Papers, 1791-2002 (M 087), Thomas Balch Library, Leesburg, VA. Search the online catalog and online indexes to the Family Files and Family Bible Records for more information Fleming, Lee, and Rust families.
1 photocopy, 2 sheets taped together. Size: 44x70 cm. Tree begins with Robert Gover (d. 1700).
Related holdings: Search the online indexes to the Family Files and Family Bible Records for more information on the Gover family.
2 photocopies, 2 sheets taped together. Size: 64x45 cm. Tree begins with Samuel Heaton (1657-1737).

Related holdings: Heaton Letters, NUCMC 20, Thomas Balch Library, Leesburg, VA. Search the online catalog and online indexes to the Family Files and Family Bible Records for more information of the Heaton, Smith, and Osburn families.

did.unittitle: Janney, compiled by Samuel Janney, drawn by DW Moser, 1935

scopecontent.p: 1 copy. Size: 62x46 cm. Tree begins with Thomas Janney (d. 1696).

Related holdings: Cosmelia Janney Hughes Sketchbook, 1945 (BV 007), Thomas Balch Library, Leesburg, VA. Search the online catalog and online indexes to the Family Files and Family Bible Records for more information on the Janney family.

did.unittitle: Lee "Genealogical Chart of the Family of Robert E. Lee, accompanies a map of notable Civil War battles in Virginia, Maryland, and West Virginia"

scopecontent.p: 1 copy in color. Size: 49x64 cm. Tree begins with John Lee of Coton Hall
Related holdings: Search the online catalog and online indexes to the Family Files and Family Bible Records for more information on the Lee family.
1 original, 2 sheets taped together; preprinted form with handwritten entries. Size: 51x42 cm. Tree begins with James Whaley (1728-1784).
Related holdings: Search the online catalog and online indexes to the Family Files and Family Bible Records for more information on the Whaley family

did.unittitle: Hoge, compiled by Lucina Hoge, published by MacBrair and Sons

scopecontent.p: 1 copy. Size: 73x53 cm. Tree begins with Solomon Hoge (1729-1811).

did.unittitle: Hoge, compiled by Lucina Hoge, published by MacBrair and Sons

scopecontent.p: 2 copies, one mounted on wood. Size: 97x70 cm. Tree begins with Solomon Hoge (1729-1811).
Related holdings: Search the online catalog and online indexes to the Family Files and Family Bible Records for more information on the Hoge, Hogue, and Hogg families.
